result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly S Crivello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Racine County or any other county.  Court will allow for early termination of Probation if Agent deems appropriate.
Concurrent with: present sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid joint/several with the co-defendant (to be paid to Target) as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the Target listed in the Criminal Complaint or the co-defendant.

Case 15CF611 is dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Any outstanding restitution/costs/fines are to be paid as a Condition of the sentence.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: May 18, 2017 Sentencing Hearing
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Katie B. Kegel in court, defendant Holly S Crivello not in court, in custody.  
Defendant was OTP'd here from MSDF - However, do to some medical issues the defendant was sent to the hospital.
Defendant was returned from the hospital and the matter was called.

State presented their recommendations.
Defense presented their recommendations.
Defendant's Mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  2.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1 Year.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Year.
146 Days Credit.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

Any outstanding restitution/costs/fines are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant to be transferred to Taycheedah - FORTHWITH.
